Message.Msg: Maybe you should write a terse letter to the New York Stock Exchange explaining to them that they don't know what they are doing and that their systems are incorrectly programmed to display too many decimal places for stocks in the $200 price range. And don't forget to throw in a few terms like "basket order," "apportioning," and "jumping the book."

Topic.Title: I admit I have been short this market

Message.Msg: 85 billion a month recycled as treasuries recycled as collateral for stock futures! Bennybux on steriods to provide the illusion of wealth.
maybe you should stop thinking you know more than you do about what someone else knows.

Topic.Title: I admit I have been short this market
I admit I have been short this market
Goldman Sachs's Kostin and his team say the index looks fully valued for now

Message.Msg: The market reached its year-end target of 1,625 “much faster than we expected,” Chief U.S. Equity Strategist said. Well that tells it all doesn't it? Shows you how much Goldman knows. Not much more than the average investor. So why does Goldman exist? To sell, sell and sell some more.

Topic.Title: Goldman Sachs's Kostin and his team say the index looks fully valued for now

Message.Msg: Sell higher in May & go away...don't you get it???

The analysis is evidence-based. For example, nobody under the age of 70 would write "splashing the tape." You also made at least 3 intensely stupid comments about the number of decimal places that are or should be available for reporting trades.
